verses.verse: Why,<WH4069> seeing times<WH6256> are not hidden<WH6845> from the Almighty,<WH7706> do they that know<WH5234> him not see<WH2372> his days?<WH3117>
Some remove<WH5472> the landmarks;<WH1367> they violently<WH1497> take<WH1497> away flocks,<WH5739> and feed<WH7462> thereof.
They drive<WH5090> away the ass<WH2543> of the fatherless,<WH3490> they take<WH2254> the widow's<WH490> ox<WH7794> for a pledge.<WH2254>
They turn<WH5186> the needy<WH34> out of the way:<WH1870> the poor<WH6035> of the earth<WH776> hide<WH2244> themselves together.<WH3162>

Behold,<WH2005> as wild<WH6501> asses<WH6501> in the desert,<WH4057> go<WH3318> they forth<WH3318> to their work;<WH6467> rising<WH7836> betimes<WH7836> for a prey:<WH2964> the wilderness<WH6160> yields food<WH3899> for them and for their children.<WH5288>
They reap<WH7114> every one his corn<WH1098> in the field:<WH7704> and they gather<WH3953> the vintage<WH3754> of the wicked.<WH7563>
They cause the naked<WH6174> to lodge<WH3885> without<WH1097> clothing,<WH3830> that they have no<WH369> covering<WH3682> in the cold.<WH7135>
They are wet<WH7372> with the showers<WH2230> of the mountains,<WH2022> and embrace<WH2263> the rock<WH6697> for want<WH1097> of a shelter.<WH4268>
They pluck<WH1497> the fatherless<WH3490> from the breast,<WH7699> and take<WH2254> a pledge<WH2254> of the poor.<WH6041>
They cause him to go<WH1980> naked<WH6174> without<WH1097> clothing,<WH3830> and they take<WH5375> away the sheaf<WH6016> from the hungry;<WH7456>
Which make oil<WH6671> within<WH996> their walls,<WH7791> and tread<WH1869> their winepresses,<WH3342> and suffer thirst.<WH6770>
Men<WH4962> groan<WH5008> from out of the city,<WH5892> and the soul<WH5315> of the wounded<WH2491> cries<WH7768> out: yet God<WH433> lays<WH7760> not folly<WH8604> to them.
They are of those that rebel<WH4775> against the light;<WH216> they know<WH5234> not the ways<WH1870> thereof, nor<WH3808> abide<WH3427> in the paths<WH5410> thereof.
The murderer<WH7523> rising<WH6965> with the light<WH216> kills<WH6991> the poor<WH6041> and needy,<WH34> and in the night<WH3915> is as a thief.<WH1590>
The eye<WH5869> also of the adulterer<WH5003> waits<WH8104> for the twilight,<WH5399> saying,<WH559> No<WH3808> eye<WH5869> shall see<WH7789> me: and disguises<WH5643> his face.<WH6440>
In the dark<WH2822> they dig<WH2864> through<WH2864> houses,<WH1004> which they had marked<WH2856> for themselves in the daytime:<WH3119> they know<WH3045> not the light.<WH216>
For the morning<WH1242> is to them even as the shadow<WH6757> of death:<WH6757> if<WH3588> one know<WH5234> them, they are in the terrors<WH1091> of the shadow<WH6757> of death.<WH6757>
He is swift<WH7031> as the waters;<WH4325> their portion<WH2513> is cursed<WH7043> in the earth:<WH776> he beholds<WH6437> not the way<WH1870> of the vineyards.<WH3754>
Drought<WH6723> and heat<WH2527> consume<WH1497> the snow<WH7950> waters:<WH4325> so does the grave<WH7585> those which have sinned.<WH2398>

The womb<WH7358> shall forget<WH7911> him; the worm<WH7415> shall feed sweetly<WH4988> on him; he shall be no<WH3808> more<WH5750> remembered;<WH2142> and wickedness<WH5766> shall be broken<WH7665> as a tree.<WH6086>
He evil<WH7462> entreats the barren<WH6135> that bears<WH3205> not: and does not good<WH3190> to the widow.<WH490>
He draws<WH4900> also the mighty<WH47> with his power:<WH3581> he rises<WH6965> up, and no<WH3808> man is sure<WH539> of life.<WH2416>
Though it be given<WH5414> him to be in safety,<WH983> where on he rests;<WH8172> yet his eyes<WH5869> are on their ways.<WH1870>

They are exalted<WH7426> for a little<WH4592> while, but are gone<WH369> and brought<WH4355> low;<WH4355> they are taken<WH7092> out of the way<WH1870> as all<WH3605> other, and cut<WH5243> off as the tops<WH7218> of the ears<WH7641> of corn.
And if<WH518> it be not so now,<WH645> who<WH4310> will make<WH7760> me a liar,<WH3576> and make<WH7760> my speech<WH4405> nothing<WH408> worth?
